title: 111_hr3574
content: Restoring Confidence Through Smarter Campaigns Act - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to limit expenditures by candidates for the House of Representatives to $500,000 during the election cycle . Sets at $250,000 the maximum amount of expenditures which may be made for a runoff election . Excludes from such limits expenditures for legal services. Provides for indexing such amounts for inflation.
